Reviews.Title: “a 'deluxe room' with deluxe wake-up sounds at 7am :-(”
Reviews.Author: Thienpont
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a typical venetian room and booked a deluxe room in this three star hotel, near the railstation. Its location is very nice, only a few meters from shops, the famous Venetian bridge and public transport in and out the city, but once in the hotel we were very disapointed. There weren't any curtains, so by night when you put on thel ight in your room, the people in the room on the other side of the hotel, only 1 meter away from your wall, can enjoy the view of you. It also looks like the hotel has to save on its costs cause every time we leave our heating was turned off by the hotel staff and it was very chilli in our deluxe room. This deluxe room was also located on a very deluxe place in the hotel , on the first floor between the stairs to the reception and the stairs to the breakfastroom and the kitchen. .This way at 7 am you wake up with the sound of hotelstaff that prepares the small breakfast in the basement without any atmosphere, doing the diches and cleaning the hallway. When we complained about the nose that waked me up this early in my vacation, there wasn't any response to make the inconvenience stop or to recompensate it. I wonder for what this hotel has recieved three stars. We stayed one night in a hotel with four stars in the center of the city and it was a world of difference. I'd rather pay some more than to go back to this wripe off

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: holidaysometimer
Reviews.Content: Great location, very handy and easy walk from station! The streets dont have names that seem to make any sense and we went at night but still found it alright as i had studied the map very well. The room was so lovely! Bathroom small ish, but its Venice! The room was a decent size as well considering the price, i was more than happy! My mother and i stayed here for 3 nights in August and loved it. Staff weren't overly helpful with luggage but its italy! i would def recommend this room to couples and travelers! We only had a standard room - but honestly could not have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: StephColex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of October. On arrival the member of staff who checked us in was friendly enough and was happy to provide information on restaurants etc, when asked. The room was very small with about 1 foot of space around the bed. The only amenities were air conditioning (not used) and a small television as well as a phone in the room. The room was clean however our biggest disappointment was how noisy it was at night and in the mornings. The stone floors, thin doors and windows meant that any returning guests would make enough noise to wake us up. In addition, from 7 in the morning the staff preparing breakfast could be heard throughout the hotel and was sufficient to wake even the deepest sleepers. All this on top of the hard mattresses meant that getting a good nights sleep was a challenge. Breakfast was a disappointment, a very basic continental breakfast with a limited choice; a few yoghurts, a couple of slices of ham and cheese per table and a bread roll. However, considering the location of the hotel, the price was very good and we would recommend to other travellers visiting Venice to stay in Venice itself as it adds greatly to the experience. It is important to note that the hotel is down a dark alleyway just off the main street. Whilst we never encountered any problems and felt safe throughout our stay, this may put off other tourists. Most of the rooms in the hotel are upstairs and there is no lift. Wi-fi is available for an additional (expensive) charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice, easy to find”
Reviews.Author: Rossie_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. This hotel was selected for it's location (close to the train station), and ease of access - it did not require the use of a boat to get to our accommodation. The location is great, and we found all we wanted within a few minutes - canals, transport, shops, restaurants. At the time we stayed, work was being done out the front to repair the pipes in the narrow laneway down which the hotel was located, but this did not cause any real inconvenience, apart from making it a bit loud when people dragged their trolley bags along it - my room faced this). The room was of reasonable size, clean, with good lighting. A safe in the room would have been nice. The bed was comfortable, and there were lots of TV stations to watch on the TV, but none in English - not a real issue, but needs to be mentioned. The decor was simple venetian style. No bath, just a good shower. The breakfast room was small but quite adequate and the food was fine - quite simple.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified hovel”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Damp walls with mould in the bedroom and bathrrom. Rusted fittings in the bedroom. The bedroom opened on to the breakfast room where the coffee and tea machines were filled from water from the nearby toilet. It is possible that others enjoyed a very different experience but for myself and my wife and two friends our experience of the accomodation on the ground floor well merits the title of my review. The attitude of the staff to my complaint amounted to a shrug of the shoulders which underlined their negative attitude. Arriving 4 minutes early for breakfast one day I was ushered away and scolded for being too early but not before seeing a half naked member of staff setting up the tables. You may think I'm just one of those 'complainers' never happy with anyhting. I would be far happier to be writing a positive review. Venice, wonderful, the Merchant of Venice hotel, tragic!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: LoveHawaii758
Reviews.Content: The room was basic: very small but clean, as was the attached bathroom which included shower only. The hotel is located in a small side street allowing for a quiet nights sleep. The breakfast room was also small, but the food provided was more than sufficient: cold cuts and cheese, croissants, fruit cocktail, yogourt, cereal, milk, cookies, crackers, coffee, tea and juice. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Luggage storage was provided upon checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vishal111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nyts.Dnt go by the outside structure or the lane in which the hotel is. The rooms are very beautiful with nice interiors.Hotel staff is very helpful.Location is excellent.Just 4 minutes from the Metro.& Ferrovera water bus station.Nice area, you can a have nice walk along the canal in the nyt. Enjoyed our stay in Venice, very beautiful place.Dnt miss to visit Burano island.Torecello can be skipped...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carito21
Reviews.Content: We were traveling like backpackers!.. When we arrived in Venezia, we asked in the train station for one good but not too expensive hotel. In the Tourist Information they recommended us 'Il Mercante di Venezia'. It was a really good choice! The hotel is very cosy, the service is good, it include a small but nice breakfast, and the price was good! ... The room was nice, but a little bit small! (I think it's an european standard for this type of hotels.) The location of the hotel is good!!. It is located in a very typical small street of Venezia and near you can find a lot of shops and restaurants!, But be sure to remind where the hotel is or get a map.. In Venezia the streets are similar and maybe you can get lost trying to find it! We had a great time in Venezia and also in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mbabane
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in November. Location was good near water bus, train station. Breakfast was good, staff were good with the exemption of one. Had trouble finding this hotel but did find the narrow alley to hotel. Could do with better information re location. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean- but very basic”
Reviews.Author: AJRHUTTON
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for two nights as part of a very reasonably priced cruise package arranged by Cruise 1st. Our cruise was with Royal Carribean , but they told us that this was one of the hotels that they used for Cunard customers. If we had been paying Cunard prices we would have been very disappointed. The hotel entrance is down a narrow alley-way about a hundred yards off the main walkway so it's a bit unaccessable for luggage. The staff are quite friendly but the hotel,although quite clean, is very basic. The position of the hotel, apart from the alley-way is very good. The main railway station, the bus station and also the water buses are all within easy walking distance. We did n't check the hotel's prices as it was part of a package, but unless it's quite cheap we would probably look for somewhere a little more upmarket. .

Reviews.Title: “Basic. No Frills”
Reviews.Author: Melbournestar
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in early November. Room cleaned daily and a good standard of room although small. Its located in a small alley so easy to miss on first visit. Location is good for water taxies,Bus and Train station. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good . I would say this is a budget hotel and on that note Breks,just to the right of the alley is excellent value for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location”
Reviews.Author: JennyJ2
Reviews.Content: Good location to find and for getting about i.e water taxis, and some lovley resturants close by. Found the hotel clean with friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “We will not come back!”
Reviews.Author: francesca005
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was extremely unpleasant. The access to our room was through a little shabby courtyard, which also communicated with the alley at the back of the building. Strange activities went on in this courtyard at night, and we were kept awake until the early hours by misterious noises just outside our door. We thought these could relate to staff doing the laundry using a sort of machine which was in a cupboard in the courtyard. Neverthless, it would have been a weird thing to do at 1 am in front of the guest bedroom. Furthermore, there was a locked door in our room, which appeared to communicate with a toilet of another bedroom or a pubblic hotel toilet. People could be heard going in and out of the toilet all night. In one instance, somebody was clearly heard vomiting. After a poor night sleep, the poor breakfast did not certainly cheer us up. In addition to all this, the two members of staff that we met on the night of our arrival were quite unfriendly. Overall, we would not recomand this hotel, neither we would come back. However, to be fair, there were some posite points. The hotel location was good, with easy access to rail and bus station. The room was big, nicely furnished, and clean. However, there were mosquitos in the room, due to damaged mosquito nets in the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: hotfinger
Reviews.Content: Two days ago, my girlfriend and I returned from a 3-day trip to Venice, Italy. We stayed in a small nice hotel about 5 minutes (walking) from the central railway station. It was located in a small alley so the room was pretty quiet. The romm itself was clean and the bed was big. It was neatly furnished and the bathroom was very clean as well. In the room, there was a small refridgerator and an air condition. The breakfast in the morning was a simple brekfast with bread rolls, ham, cheese, jelly, cereals, coffee, etc. The staff was very nice and spoke English fluently. Overall, I can say that the stay was very comfortable and I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, threadbare, with no a/c”
Reviews.Author: JenJenLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Poor value for the money you spend and not worth the money you will save for staying at this tiny, ill-kempt hotel. The beds were flat and uncomfortable, the bathroom door didn't even close, the room was full of mosquitos because a broken air -conditioning system meant having to leave the french doors open, and there were no blackout shades so sleeping in was impossible. The only plus to this hotel is its location which is just steps from the train station and a major hub for the water bus. Don't be fooled by terms like "quaint" and "authentic" when what they really mean is outdated and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little family owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: locutus243
Reviews.Content: This hotel is initially a little difficult to find, hidden down a side street off the main path from the station. However, once you find it then it is a nice place to stay. The location is excellent as it is easy walking distance from train station, bus station and to see the city, without any of the noise you would associate from a hotel right on the canal or on a main thoroughfare. The double room we had was ornate, quite large with some beautiful furniture that wouldn't be out of place in a C.S. Lewis novel. All of the staff were helpful and friendly and happy to help with anything we should need.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it promised”
Reviews.Author: alastairm
Reviews.Content: We had a deligthful time spending 4 nights in mid March 2007 (it helps that we love Venice and the weather was perfect). The room was exactly as pictured; a little small (partly because bed was king size) and beautifully decorated. Locaton is very convenient, especially if arriving by train. In spite of being steps from train station and grand canal it was very quiet -- but noise from other rooms seems to travel easily. Price was the lowest I could find in the city at the time. Breakfast is pretty mediocre (and per my wife the coffee is horrid) but got our day started. All the staff were pleasant and highly efficient. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rd133
Reviews.Content: Great location - a quick walk from the train station. Our room was very comfortable - it was in the back with a little balcony - very quiet. I would definitely stay here again. I have to say the front desk staff we encountered were not especially friendly but overall I would recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Il Mercante di Venezia
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 379 | Calle della Misericordia, 30121 Venice, Italy
